title: Danish Golf Union
text:
The Danish Golf Union (, DGU) is the <a href="Sport%20governing%20body">governing body</a> for the <a href="sport">sport</a> of <a href="golf">golf</a> in <a href="Denmark">Denmark</a>. It manages the national golf teams, the national golf championships, and maintains the Rules of Golf in <a href="Danish%20language">Danish</a>.
DGU was founded in 1931 by Esbjerg Golfklub, Helsingør Golf Club, Odense Golfklub and Københavns Golf Klub, Denmark's oldest golf club founded in 1898. DGU became a member of the <a href="European%20Golf%20Association">European Golf Association</a> (EGA) in 1958 and is a member of <a href="Danmarks%20Idr%C3%A6ts-Forbund">Danmarks Idræts-Forbund</a>, the <a href="National%20Olympic%20Committee%20and%20Sports%20Confederation%20of%20Denmark">National Olympic Committee and Sports Confederation of Denmark</a>.
DGU organizes around 150,000 active golfers and around 190 golf clubs in Denmark. 
Championships.
DGU organizes the following championships for men and women (eligible age in brackets):
National Team.
DGU develops and manages the Danish National Golf Team.
